abstract: Rio de Janeiro is set to break pledge of cutting by 80 percent the flow of sewage and garbage into Guanabara Bay, where 2016 Olympics sailing and wind surfing competitions are to be held.
lead_paragraph: Rio de Janeiro will not make good on its pledge of cutting by 80 percent the flow of sewage and garbage into Guanabara Bay, where the 2016 Olympics sailing and wind surfing competitions are to be held.
snippet: Rio de Janeiro will not make good on its pledge of cutting by 80 percent the flow of sewage and garbage into Guanabara Bay, where the 2016 Olympics sailing and wind surfing competitions are to be held.

headline.main: Rio de Janeiro Set to Break Its Pledge
